intro: Crepis karelinii, commonly known as the Karelin's mouse-ear, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Its leaves are hairy and form a rosette, while the flowers are small and yellow, often grouped in clusters. Crepis karelinii is primarily of interest to botanists and horticulturists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
